intro: Oliveriana uribe-velezii, commonly known as the Uribé-Vélez's oliverina, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or montane habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential role in local ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
